answerText: viscosity[10] This quantity is equal to the dynamic viscosity times the derivative of the velocity with respect to the boundary height for certain fluids. This force occurs due to friction between the fluid and the wall.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 12 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One device used to measure this quantity measures efflux time as a proxy for it, and this quantity appears in the numerator of the Poiseuille (pwah-SAY) equation. For 10 points each: [10] Name this quantity measured in units of poise. This quantity is the resistance of a fluid to flow.
